chargeHist.descr: 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety(939.62(1)(b) Repeater)(939.63(1)(b) Use Dangerous Weapon)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Alvin Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Injury by Negligent Use/Weapon/Explosive, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.24(1).
  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript SENTENCING HEARING  (31 pages) commencing JUNE 13, 2014 received and filed.

Defendant Alvin Johnson in court with attorney Debra J Patterson.  Defendant Alvin Johnson in custody.  Marissa L Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk:  ss

AS TO COUNT 2:

  Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant. :
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 5 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 3 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence, credit for 96 days.
Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program AFTER serving 18 months of this sentence.
-Restitution set at zero
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 06-13-2020; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge  to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 06-13-2020; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
--Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any couseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications
-Employment or school - vocational training
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he/she may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he/she may not vote in any election until his/her civil rights have been restored.


AS TO COUNT 1:

  Court sentenced defendant to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to any sentence with credit for zero days served; STRAIGHT TIME

Provide DNA sample and pay the cost of same by 06-13-2020  Failure to pay will result in the entry of a civil judgement
Pay all costs, fees, assessments and surcharges by 06-13-2020. Failure to pay will result in the entry of a civil judgement

Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement

AS TO COUNTS 1:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY to the amended charge.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.
AS TO COUNT 2:
On motion of the State, Court ordered the "Repeater" enhancer DISMISSED.
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY to the amended charge.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.
 Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored. Case calendared for SENTENCING on 6/13/2014 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.

Defendant Alvin Johnson in court with attorney Debra J Patterson.  Defendant Alvin Johnson in custody.  Marissa L Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
The State filed an amending COUNT 1 to:
 Injury by Negligent Handling of Dangerous Weapon, Explosives or Fire, pursuant to Wis Stat 940.24(1), a class "I" Felony

Attorney Debra J. Patterson in court, defendant Alvin Johnson not in court, in custody.  Marissa L. Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Case calendared for PROJECTED PLEA on 5/2/2014 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Alvin Johnson in court with attorney Debra J. Patterson.  Defendant Alvin Johnson in custody.  Randy Sitzberger for Marissa L. Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15.    Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 1, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision and Electronic Monitoring.  To be monitored by drug testing.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with D.L. and T.C.

Defendant Alvin Johnson in court with attorney Debra J. Patterson.  Defendant Alvin Johnson in custody.  Carole R. Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 19, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
